com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio

Class SapaProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio.SapaProcessor

  • public final class SapaProcessor
extends Object
    This class is the proxy class for processing modules. It provides the processing module functionality in the Professional Audio package.

    Processing modules generate, modulate, or transform audio stream data or MIDI data. You can use a processing module plug-in provided with the Professional Audio package or create your own custom plug-in processing module.
    Since:
    Samsung Android JellyBean
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    HaeSeok Oh, LaeHyuk Bang, JeongYeon Kim, DaeBeom Park

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SapaProcessor.MessageListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods to receive messages and data from the processing module.
      static interface  SapaProcessor.StatusListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for status change events when the processing module terminates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SapaProcessor

        public SapaProcessor(Context context,
             SapaService.PluginInfo info,
             SapaProcessor.StatusListener listener)
        Creates a SapaProcessor instance with the specified processing module plug-in.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        info - The processing module plug-in information object.
        Use SapaService.getPluginList() to get the list of available processing module plug-ins.
        listener - The StatusListener instance to receive status change events when the processing module terminates.

      • SapaProcessor

        public SapaProcessor(Context context,
             SapaService.PluginInfo info,
             SapaProcessor.StatusListener listener,
             String args)
        Creates a SapaProcessor instance with the specified processing module plug-in with the specified message.

        This constructor is only valid for custom processing module plug-ins. Use this constructor to pass additional parameters to the custom processing module plug-in. For more information on the parameters available in the processing module, see the relevant processing module plug-in manual.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        info - The processing module plug-in information object.
        Use SapaService.getPluginList() to get the list of available processing modules.
        listener - The StatusListener instance to receive status change events when the processing module terminates.
        args - The additional parameters for setting up the custom processing module plug-in.

    • Method Detail

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(String command)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                        RuntimeException
        Send the specified command to the processing module.
        For more information on the commands available in the processing module, see the relevant processing module plug-in manual. You can define your own commands when you create a custom processing module plug-in.
        Parameters:
        command - The command string for the processing module.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the command passed is not valid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown if an error occurs while sending the command.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(String command,
               int id)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                        RuntimeException
        Send the specified command and ID to the processing module.
        For more information on the commands and the corresponding IDs available in the processing module, see the relevant processing module plug-in manual. You can define your own commands and IDs when you create a custom processing module.

        Parameters:
        command - The command string for the processing module.
        id - The command ID.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parameters passed are not valid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown if an error occurs while sending the command.

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Activate the processing module.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivate the processing module.

      • setTransportEnabled

        public void setTransportEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable transport.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set to true to enable transport, set to false to disable transport.

      • queryData

        public ByteBuffer queryData(String query,
                   int extra)
        Request data from the processing module.
        The request() method of the processing module receives this query request. This is a synchronous call.
        For more information on the queries available in the processing module, see the relevant processing module plug-in manual.
        You can define queries and possible extra values when you create a custom processing module plug-in.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to be executed.
        extra - An extra value for custom processing module plug-ins.
        Returns:
        The query result as a read -only ByteBuffer.

      • setMessageListener

        public final void setMessageListener(SapaProcessor.MessageListener listener)
        Set the specified MessageListener instance to receive messages and data from the processing module.
        Parameters:
        listener - The MessageListener interface. to receive messages and data from the processing module.

      • setStatusListener

        public void setStatusListener(SapaProcessor.StatusListener listener)
        Set the specified StatusListener instance to receive status change events when the processing module terminates.
        If this process unexpectedly terminates, the SapaProcessor.StatusListener.onKilled() method is called.
        Parameters:
        listener - The StatusListener instance to receive status change events when the processing module terminates.
